description:

Having a Discovery Store where they have showcased how they are able to engage with their customers by bringing digital to the physical environment, has provided an amazing innovations platform for a roll out to other stores. The Discovery store has also allowed Telstra to reflect the values of their company on a large scale.

What did they change?

Engagis worked with Telstra to create, “The Store Of The Future”. Whether its a giant curved digital screens with video content, or a Sandbox tabletop where the customer controls the information they receive interactively – this really is a store which sets the benchmark for the phygital space.

How has it worked out?

The success of the Sydney Discovery Store has been a driving factor for the roll out across all Telstra stores over the next 5 years and has set the tone for the Telstra Future Retail Environment (FRE), also delivered by Engagis across their 400+ locations Australia wide. What’s more, this store is not all smoke and mirrors; the interactive and customer engagement solutions in store are delivering an improved ROI, delivering more sales and driving a huge increase in advocacy among Telstra customers.
article: Sydney Discovery Store's success is the frontier of development across Telstra stores in the next five years.

title: 7-Eleven Digital Signage Success
description:
What was holding them back?

In such a high – foot traffic, convenience based network like 7-Eleven, there are many opportunities to engage better with consumers. With Engagis’ help, the Convenience giant was seeking to understand the best technology available and to ensure delivery of tailored promotions to the right person, at the right time in order to drive conversions. Ultimately, this personalised messaging would drive sales in higher profit margin products and help deliver a substantial ROI.

What did they change?

In collaboration with Data Science firm Harris Partners, Engagis conducted a thorough Test and Learn program across a number of 7-Eleven sites to measure the effectiveness of a range of in store digital solutions. These digital solutions included digital signage, interactive screens and dynamic, personalised content. Digital signage included small format on shelf displays as well as large format menu boards behind the counter. Small format interactive touch screens were also deployed at the point of purchase to drive impulse sales.

How has it worked out?

After a number of control stores were analysed against the “enhanced digital store”, 7-Eleven saw clear and quantifiable lifts in sales directly from the content and promotions across the digital signage, interactive screens and content. Upon completion of the Test And Learn program, 7-Eleven awarded Engagis the rollout of the most effective solutions, after experiencing up to 400% increase in sales on some promoted product lines.
article: With up to 400% increase in sales on promoted product lines, 7-Eleven recognised Engagis' rollout of great solutions.

title: Telstra Future Retail Environment (FRE)
description:

The ability to engage with customers through digital interaction on a large scale is crucial to Telstra. The longstanding Engagis – Telstra partnership will enable the Telco to be at the forefront of digital engagement and truly connect with customers anytime & anywhere.

What did they change?

After analysing the Telstra customer pathway to purchase, Engagis has developed effective digital technology – be it digital signage, touchscreens and mobile applications – across each of Telstra’s in store touch points. Solutions include digital video walls for Apple products, tech bars to engage, media fountains to entertain, as well as virtual aisles and interactive digital tickets to inform customers. All interactions come together via analytics which help deliver ROI and provide critical data to Telstra.

How has it worked out?

Engagis’s partnership with Telstra has been the platform for the telco retailer’s in store success and innovation in recent years. Engagis technology has helped increase sales significantly as well as driving impressions, interactions and engagement in store. Analytics tools allow Telstra to measure the customer’s data accurately, and as a result target promotions and communications to the right customer at the right time.
article: It’s a new age for analytics—analyzing interactions in store to get critical data and deliver ROI

title: Ray White Oakleigh
description:
What we did

I noticed that all my competitors in the area had them, so I thought I’ll put a couple in the windows just to start with — obviously I ended up putting in a touchscreen as well. We [use the screen to] pick their price range and what suburbs they’re looking for and the touchscreen does the rest. It brings up a numerous amount of properties that we can show people prior to going out — all the internal photography and so forth. And we’re now going to start [including] video, so we have a video display going on as well.

What’s the benefit

A lot of people will say displays have no bearing on new business. Our numbers are definitely way up. Vendors want to be on the windows, and it’s really probably sold me more than I ever would have [by myself].
article: Hear why the owner of Ray White Oakleigh chose Engagis to manage his Ray White Touch Screens.

Telstra’s new and improved Proximity solution allows today’s marketers to create differentiated consumer experiences:

  • Incorporates rich content creation and media management, allowing retailers to use targeted, relevant and personalised content to connect more intimately with customers.
  • Includes the Eze WiFi App, which makes it simple for retailers to capture data, deepen customer engagement and gain powerful insights into the performance of a campaign.

For more information, speak to your Telstra account executive; if you’re unsure who they are, call 1300TELSTRA (1300 835 787) Monday to Friday, 9am-5pm.

description:
What prompted you to go digital?

I always wanted to fix the menus up, and that was the biggest reason I went to a digital menu board. Cutting this admin time for staff allowed them to focus on more important job of servicing customers.

How has it worked out?

At first it was a little daunting but soon after we noticed that the sales of our items really improved. It’s so much easier to put a new item on the menu. It’s so much easier to change an item, and it looks much more professional.

title: How Sheridan grabbed more screen time with its customers

What did they change?

They then ported the system to iPad to increase potential for reps to freely roam the Myer stores and demonstrate Sheridan products.

How has it worked out?

Behind the scenes, the HTML5 interface ensured a seamless user experience regardless of whether staff and clients used the touchscreen or the tablet. title: VR: In a nutshell
description:
Technology has gone way beyond our expectation. Today, you can gain knowledge of a thing, shop for items and have it delivered on your doorstep, interact with people across the globe and do so many things without having step out of your house.

Now, with the rise of digital technology, comes the VR or the virtual reality. You may have heard of the term before, but what is it really? And what impacts can it have in our present day reality? Let’s find out.

VR or virtual reality is an artificial environment created through the use of computer technology. What makes it unique is its ability to simulate real environment, as well as the senses to make a virtual experience as close to reality as it possible.

It is commonly accessed through head-mounted displays or data gloves. It can do much, one is provide a 3D panoramic view of a place and you can even have a walkthrough the environment. With its latest innovations, VR doesn’t only let you see, but also feel, hear and smell a put-on atmosphere.

The most popular application of VR is in the field of entertainment. Its ability to provide an interactive environment makes the seeing and gaming experience even more real. You can travel across the globe, experience an event (concerts, Olympics games, etc.), or even go to another planet!

Aside from these entertainment capacities, it can be used to improve more vital fields like education, data analysis, architecture, engineering and medicine. In these fields, there is continued development of the VR that can help test and apply scientific processes before actually doing it.

With a myriad capacities, VR is on the rise. It can be used across different fields and industries for quite a lot of functions. It enables us to have an immersive experience of different environments. Indeed, technology is changing so many things in the way we live. It doesn't only let see, but also experience new possibilities.

Image source: www.vrscout.com
article: Learn how virtual reality is making it realer this time.

title: QSRs are keeping up with the times
description:
In this age of high technology, digital devices and content are consuming more hours of our day. Quick service restaurants (QSRs) have piqued this trend and shifted to digital.

From digital menu boards to touch screen ordering kiosks, restaurants are changing customer experience, making their journey more personal, convenient and quick. The technology reduces waiting time while letting customers self-serve.

Catering every age group, especially the millennials, self-service kiosks not only display menu upfront, and lets customers personalize their orders. Whether they want that extra cheese on their burger, or more jalapeños on their fries, just a tapping this genie can grant those wishes. By giving customer what they need and want, they can up sales and guarantee ROI.

These kiosks are said to be a threat in restaurant jobs as they reduce the need for staffing. However, these digital order-takers aide in the overall operation of the restaurant and cannot completely replace live staff.

With all its perks, the self-service kiosks still has a lot to come up with many improvements to provide a better customer experience, not only to please the young ones, but everyone who eats.

As technology develops in a fast pace, QSRs are keeping up by integrating it in their operations. As digital seems to be more attractive, it engages more customers. It’s no surprise that self-service kiosks are a hit, making the restaurant industry so trendy.

Image source: blog.ignify.com
article: Restaurants have found a new best friend that drives more customer in!

title: 5 tips to have a good digital  signage
description:
It’s a well known fact that successful websites, blogs and social media networks attribute their popularity to having the right content at the right time. Content also takes the crown of the digital signage world. The best digital signage intentions can be lost without the right choice in content to display the right message at any location at any desired time. Let’s take a look at 5 must haves for making content a success across your digital signage network.

1. A Content Management System Which Can Be Managed Remotely

The use of a cloud based content management system should be the first priority in managing digital signage content. A great content management system allows content to be automatically scheduled, ensuring targeted and relevant advertising and compliance across hundreds of store locations, as well as the ability to showcase multiple promotions on a single day , and a single screen. A content management system with the ability to schedule content based on time, day, date or region is the most essential step in making content scalable across a network of stores.

2. Analytics

Insightful analytics build the platform for testing and learning from each and every message promoted across a digital sign. Not only do analytics provide insights into dwell time, engagement levels and view time; they also enable the content to be intuitive as to the demographics of the customer such as gender, age, and even the weather outside. The result is a continuously improved and more personalised message which will ultimately lead to better engagement for you and your customers.

3. Call To Action

Much like any effective marketing campaign, content for digital signage needs a clear call to action. The best designed content can become nothing more than wall art without an effective purpose which provides the audience with a perception of value and a clear call to action.

4. Attention Grabbing Visuals

Once you have established a clear and compelling call to action, it’s time to start having some fun with the actual content that is going to be displayed. The visuals must be dynamic and attention grabbing, to ensure higher attraction and engagement levels with the customer. It is important to remember that digital signage is another touch point of your marketing mix and therefore the imagery and design should be kept clear and consistent with your other advertising and branding platforms.

5. Is The Content Entertaining, Informative Or Educational

Your message will either be entertaining, informational or educational and the first step is to determine which one of these three traits your message should be; and then ensure that the message you produce addresses it’s intended purpose. Having an amusing animation might be great fun, but if it doesn’t meet your objective of being informative, the effect on the customer may not be as intended.
article: Look into these musts in creating the right content for your digital signage platform.

title: 2016 digital marketing trends
description:
It is quite undeniable that the world is becoming a digital one. With high technology, everything is at our fingertips; from getting new information, ordering food, gaming to dating. The rapid development of technology has changed the landscape of marketing.

Today, there key digital trends that affect how marketing is evolving. We’ve discovered some and these are the following:

1. Content Marketing is greatly impacted by the digital shift. Business marketers can take this advantage to make the best content for increased attraction and engagement.

2. Social Media is a good way of responding to the change in customer behavior. With a more personal and interactive approach, marketing in social media platforms is more accessible and sharable.

3. Video is the game-changer. By stimulating more senses, video contents are more attractive and engaging. With its availability on various platforms, videos can be shared across different social media creating new connections.

4. Humanised and personalised content are in. Marketers target customers on a personal level. Getting across with simple yet meaningful content best get their attention.

5. Customer experience remains as the top priority. Get their attention and captivate customers with optimised design and content that always put them into consideration--capture their pain points and provide a solution.

With the digital escalation, the possibilities of positive outcome of these trends and many others are not quite quantifiable. It’s up to digital marketers to use these to their advantage and make it work for their brand’s success.

title: Delight customers in-store with digital signage
description:
As customers increasingly become digitally savvy, many retailers will likely transition from the good old banners to digital signage. They are highly effective tools used for sales, catering more marketing needs while the retailers take a seat back and relax.

Knowing the power of digital technology sets marketing expectations on a new high. It can do so much, such as, provide information, sell products, entertain, and interact with customers. Its flexibility allows retailers to tailor-fit content to serve their business needs.

With more consumers saying digital signage catches their attention, it’s high time for retailers to use it effectively. To increase the impact on brand perceptions, sales, and engagement, there are handy tips that could be used to create the best content, driving a successful customer experience.

Content is king

Before thinking what screen or tablet to use and where to place them, think about your digital content first. It is what gets your messages across–attract, entertains and engages customer at every touch point. Here are a few things you might want to consider.

- Tell stories. A Princeton University study found out that stories play a vital role in shaping how we think and respond to what our stimulates us. So, load up your digital displays with captivating videos, images, and texts and make relatable to get customers into your store.

- Simplicity is key. Although designs are highly attractive, it’s just appropriate no to go overboard with colors and typography. A simple content has less clutter and attractive in a way that it drives trust with limited brand colors and good but short texts.

- Make it like art. Keep your composition aligned to the rules. As you only have a short amount of time to attract customer, place your elements in a way that attract and focuses their attention.

Pick your canvas

There is wide array of digital signage, not only limited to digital screens. Depending on your need and budget, there is a lot to choose from. From screens to LED panels, tablets and mobile devices, interactive touch screens and tables, you have options to optimize your displays according to the experience you wish to offer.

Scheduling and content queuing

Now that you have your content and know where to load them, you have to set up what to show and when to show them. You don’t want to show your customers the winter collection on a hot day in June. This is why scheduling is important. Load up and queue you media accordingly to better suit your customers' mood at a particular time.

Information and wayfinder

Create a more personalised experience for your customers by offering a venue for them to get info and find their own way around your store. By keeping a simple navigation, they’ll be able to engage with your brand. This service could pull customers into your store.

Location strategy

Another important point to consider is where to strategically place your signage. It should be able to give them the best impression of the brand entrance and a lasting one when the leave. So, think about where to place those digital signage to effectively carry out your messages.

As technology is continually evolving, digital signage do so as well. It is very much affected by how people (your customers) take them. It’s arbitrary, and there is no fixed way of going about it. However, keeping these tips in mind might help you create a great digital signage leading to a successful customer experience.

Original article published on digitalsignagetoday.com.
article: The power of digital technology sets retail marketing expectations on a new high.

title: Mobile devices and digital signage team up for better engagement
description:
Today, as digital signage changes the way companies do business, its innovations are becoming common words, such facial recognition, interactive screens, and the like. However, before all these, there exists a device that has been a game changer and sits right in our pockets–the mobile phone. Now, they can be partners in giving a more personal customer experience.

You might start wondering how this is possible. Here, let’s do a bit of dissection.

Collaboration

Companies that use digital signage can now interact with audience through a unique connection. With the partnership of the digital signage in-store and the customer’s mobile device, a personalized content is displayed. This is processed by the smart device within the screen that gets data from the customer’s mobile device to tailor-fit content according to interests.

Personalised messages

Using digital signage with a beacon latched onto a nearby customer’s smartphone, brands can now deliver targeted messages. This way, the experience is altered for the better.

For example, a young lady steps into a store, is identified by a beacon, which then prompts informative content to her phone: women’s shoes and bags that have discounts at the moment. Companies can now feed the consumers with information that are relevant. With this, it creates a touchpoint where consumers feel their needs, which the company has solutions to.

The information elicited by the beacon is then gathered and can be accessed by the company. Even outside the proximity, connection to the customers is not lost.

Analytics

With the use of Wi-Fi or Bluetooth, tracking of audience’s movement is now possible, which is another way to do target messaging. The interaction of the digital signage and the mobile device determine the messages. Moreover, it allows companies to track interests and pain points to help them market relevant products, increasing positive response to sales.

By giving a unique experience to the customer, companies can engage them and give them messages that make a deeper connection and build trust, which in turn, bringing more purchases

Original article published on www.digitalsignagetoday.com.
article: A new tandem's about to make it big together, giving nearby customers a unique experience.

title: You only need 2 things for customers to stay loyal
description:
Imagine walking into a shopping centre requiring you to leave your shoes at the doorstep and don’t have overhead signs of what products are on every aisle. Would you want to make a purchase? Or, if you just had to at the moment, would you come back? The answer is a “No.”

Compare that experience to being welcomed by a sales staff into a furniture shop that smells like coffee as the door swings open and having the luxury of trying their products. Plus, staff are always in sight whenever you call for help. Ain’t that delightful?

The two are obviously apart from each other, in the way that they give two opposing experiences to customers. As the first situation presents an industry that provides what customers need a lot, it makes them unfireable, which means that they can’t leave. Meanwhile, in the second situation, it drives customers in by making them feel wanted, which makes the business unleavable.

Between the two, the better option is to be unleaveable. Here are the only two things you need to do that, according to Jason Forest of Entrepreneur.com.

1. Create what your customers love

The reason why you have customers is that you make their lives better. Whether you offer a product or service, they must feel that you are dependable. So, it’s high time to let your best foot forward and throw mediocrity out the window.

Don’t give them what they don’t want. Rather, get them to trust you more. Give them the best experience, like taking their concerns sincerely and solving them quickly. That way, they would be happy, and would want to stay with you.

2. Make your customers feel important

To demonstrate this point better, let’s go back to our second situation. By giving your customers some kind of comfort, it makes them feel wanted. By giving them the warmest welcome, chances are, they wouldn’t want to leave. It will elevate your brand by creating an unequalled experience as the furniture with no restrictions like “No sitting.”

With this instance, it makes them feel like they are home, and you being part of their lives. So, think of ways your customers feel that you are for them, and are willing to serve a purpose in their lives.

Though it might be a simple move on your end, when you create a good experience for your customers, it will alter their perception of your brand. Find ways you can build exceptional connections with them. Give them what they want and make them feel important. That way, you just might be unleavable.

Original article published on Entrepreneur.com.
article: When you keep these in check, it’d be hard for your customer to leave you.

title: Augmented Reality: Shaping the future of retail
description:
The digital age enables retail merchants to create a modern shopping experience with augmented reality (AR). According to Juniper Research, downloads of AR apps will swarm up to 2.5 billion in the next year as it revolutionises the retail industry.

AR is changing the landscape of shopping by merging physical reality with digital overlay. Recognising the benefits of online shopping, such as, quick products search, store locator, and payment options, retailers advance their strategy by bridging the gaps between online and in-store shopping.

Brands can build new and more personal connections with their customers by enhancing their shopping experience through AR apps. With a key feature of overlaying virtual elements with what’s physically there, the journey to purchase is improved.

The influence on retail

While the integration is developing, brands may start to let it be known to many. They can start with QR codes in magazines or spicing up the actual imaging with virtual elements.

title: Digital signage transforms education
description:
As the efforts of institutions to improve curricula and student engagement are geared for success in the workplace, transforming education is possible with innovations in technology, such as digital and interactive displays. As they contribute to the learning experience, they can be equitable investments.

However, this move to create a better experience isn’t dependent on technology alone. It’s also the way it builds better opportunities for teacher and students to connect and engage. It does not only empower students, but also, create a venue for collaborative learning. By fostering a shared experience among students and with their teachers, technology creates a new learning environment.

The needs across educational levels differ, which is important to look into. One of the challenges is to create solutions that cater the different levels as all of which are vital to the society.

The K-12 challenge

One-to-one computing has long been adapted in many schools as shift from the usual teacher in front of the class, which is a one-to-many method. Despite the benefits the shift has posed, the need for an educator in front of the room isn’t eradicated.

The acquisition of the computers/tablets and digital displays is just the beginning of an uphill journey. Researches say that there’s more to do than put them in the classrooms. Learning shall be facilitated closely by the teacher, which the technology can enhance.

As the students have their own devices, which are wirelessly connected to the digital display (usually located in front of the room), interactive and collaborative learning can take place. Also, this lets schools do away with bulb projectors that need dimming of rooms.

Recognising the need for the digital shift, a school in the US invested in technology. By placing digital touchscreens systems, they are enhancing the learning experience.

The higher education challenge

The rollout of technologies in higher education institutions are of almost the same purpose as in the K-12 systems. But, there are different obstacles to surmount, as college lessons are complex and have some kind of variety.

The need is somehow different in higher learning, where better services and capabilities are needed, such as multi-platform functionality, recording, and real-time uploading of information. This is how it can transform the good old lecture in the classroom into an interactive one not only inside the four corners of the classroom.

A concrete example of such is at Caldwell University in New Jersey, USA where they installed interactive displays across campus, and around its nursing skills laboratory. The technology is believed to have increased student-faculty collaborations and enrolment in their nursing program.

As a learning experience can be so complex, some schools even install massive screens for students to watch events, which is great move to bring students together. It can attract currently enrolled and prospective students as well as faculty.

The learning process, from kindergarten up to college and post grad, has evolved so much and is going beyond tablets and smartphones. Digital displays, interactive screens and video wall are the new tools in enhancing the learning experience to better engage students and prepare them to be successful in the workplace.

Original article published on digitalsignagetoday.com. Image retrieved from blogs.sjsu.edu.
article: The traditional learning culture is going modern with technology.

title: Digital Signage Market to reach 20.1 billion USD in value by 2020
description:
According to a report by Hexa Research, the global digital signage market is anticipated to reach returns worth 20.1 billion USD by 2020. The projected growth in the market from 2014-2020 is at 6.1% compound annual growth rate (CAGR) from about 13.3 billion USD in 2013.

The market is projected to grow over the forecast period, affected by emerging factors. Among these factors are user experience, low-cost display panels, and cost-effective promotion.

The reality is that the digital shift possibly poses risks on traditional advertising, such as the print media, because it lacks dynamic features. One of the features that greatly impacts the decline the preference of print is the interactive graphical user interface of digital signage, web and mobiles sites and applications.

The demand for digital signage is greatly influenced by market and technology infrastructure development and the declining of display panel prices. Digital-out-of-home (DOOH) systems are projected to increase market demand. The movement in organic LED or more popularly known as OLED base displays in mobile devices will push the market development as well. The market, however, is thwarted by the lack of awareness and issues on power and high investment cost.

The digital signage market is divided based on applications, technologies and geographies.

  • Applications of digital signage have spread across industries including retail, finance, restaurants, transportation, healthcare, and education. Some popular purposes in using the technology are way finding, advertising, promotions, communications, point of transit (POT), point of sale (POS) and infotainment.
  • The analysis was based on the research which included LCD, NED LED displays and front projection technologies in its scope. In 2013, LCD has a huge part that was recorded to be 50% of global revenues. In the near future, LED will be spread across the market with its energy saving ability.
  • It is foreseen that developed nations like Europe and North America are to have a major growth in the digital signage market because of technological development and urbanization. However, the biggest market is seen in nations that are in good financial condition and development across different industries, such as US and Asia Pacific. There is also a foreseen expansion in digital market among developing countries like India and China as their retail sector, customer livelihood and purchase power are advancing.

Many companies are innovating digital products that greatly impact the market. To see more of the insights from the research, click here.

title: Wayfinding solutions can improve passenger experience
description:
The navigation in a large and complex place or wayfinding isn’t an easy job for companies, institutions or organizations. Brainstorming on how to route people to specific areas in a facility is quite laborious, especially in hectic places where people move hastily—like in transportation hubs.

As digital technology is emerging and gradually taking over almost all establishments, it makes for better experiences across industries, including transportation. The traditional signage, such as flags, overhead placards, wall stickers at bus or rail stations and airports are slowly becoming out-dated in the digital age.

Mental clutch
In such high-traffic areas, information is very relevant. More importantly, it has to be clear, concise and quick. Passengers are on a rush and would want to see where they should get their ride in a snap. This is what static signage is employed for.

According to research, it takes 8 seconds to clearly and concisely get a message across. Any further than that will get passengers confused and would less probably decide to take public transport.

As these systems are complicated, the job of wayfinding is to simplify and make it easier for passengers to get and process information they need to quickly decide on their actions. It’s a challenge to create substantial messages or content to route them properly and quickly.

Digital disruption
Going back to the traditional signage (plastic/metal placards, etc.), an issue was seen since it is only static, but has high costs. Moreover, in cases when routes and locations inside a complex area are changed, it would take much work and money to design, create and deploy static signage.

This is an opportunity to disrupt the transportation industry—by going digital. It enables establishments to create stylish and dynamic messages to communicate information that passengers want and need.

Digital signage can be managed remotely, which can feed real-time information to the public. When messages need to be changed, it would be no trouble to load the media content and broadcast it to the network of screens.

With digital and interactive kiosks, messages will be tailored according to what the passenger seeks. Whether it’s a map to the specific terminal gates or a schedule of trips, it’ll cater their query in a shorter time.

Aside from these, more technological devices are available such as mobile phones and digital watches that allow targeted messaging. It delivers clear and concise information, maximising capability and making way for better passenger experience.

Original article published on www.masstransitmag.com.
article: Digital technology innovates signage in the transportation industry.

title: Create an online Path to Purchase with these 4 tips
description:
Today, the value of digital marketing is emerging. Because online sources and applications are what most people to turn to for information, it is very influential in reaching new customers. However, we have to understand social media more and its impacts on the grassroots.

Communicating your brand for awareness is already a plus, but there’s a better way to lay out a path to purchase that’s easily actionable. It is a great opportunity, which is why it is best to look into these tips to turn your followers, impressions and engagements into sales.

1. Let your existence be known.

First of all, people need to know you. There are tip tops ways you can increase brand awareness online, such as banners and sponsored posts on social media sites.

Despite the quality of sponsored posts of bringing targeted messages, it might be distracting them from what they are doing online, whether surfing or reading. The tendency for them to be frustrated is high and would lead them to unsubscribe to the ads.

Action point: Strategise partnerships to reach your target organically. Collaborate with brands that are similar to yours; the ones that are influential. Such partnerships will raise your brand awareness and establish your following.

2. Let your followers be inspired

To inspire your followers to buy your product, create high-quality and engaging content. What is the purpose? How can it benefit their lives?

If they find your content good, they will respond to it positively by hitting “like” or leaving comments and sharing with their friends.

Action point: Create impressive content that builds connections with your followers. Fashion your content that makes them need your product. Encourage them to share their experience of your brand.

3. Make an insightful website

The emergence of social media has created an opportunity to increase brand awareness. However, it does not replace your website. Although social media is a strong platform, it is better to have a website that lets your fans discover you more, making them highly aware of your brand. In turn, it will make them customers.

As your fans will turn to social media for information about your brand, there will be a tendency for them to be confused with many social channels. When they look for specific products, information, and locations, they will look for an official source.

Make your website user-friendly so that you can engage your customers. By letting them navigate easily through your well-established website, they can look for information about you and your product quickly. This way, you can engage them with your brand.

Action point: Let people find about you and/or your products easily. Create social channels with a link to your website. Your website should contain necessary information about you, as well as your contact details and location (geographical or online) for your customers to connect with you.

4. Make a call to action

You are close to turning your followers into customers.

As you are already visible, make the buying process easy and quick by making a call to action in your posts. As your fans already know about you, they may not have known about what else you offer, such as newsletters, recipes, or locators on your website.

Some common call to action statements are: “Click the link to our profile to buy” or “Sign up on our website now!”

Action point: Don’t let your followers slip away. Lead them to your website. Make a sale.

Orginal article published on entrepreneur.com. Photo retrieved from greendotadvertising.com.
article: Use these media strategies to gain sales from followers, impressions and engagements.

title: Facial recognition technology saves thousands of lives
description:
Some developments in technology that we thought were to come in the future or could only exist in our imagination such as artificial intelligence and self-driving cars are already a reality. Google’s self-driving car has already driven miles; Tesla’s can drive independently under certain conditions; and by the end of the year, a fully autonomous taxi could be seen running the streets of Singapore.

As these advancements are focused on the car’s external potentials, such as enabling machines to process and respond to their outside environment, it is equally vital to consider the man in the machine.

This is what Canberra-based Seeing Machines seeks to achieve. Hence, they created a camera that can comprehend when drivers are fatigued or distracted. It is said that the solution helped save thousands of lives from accidents.

A group of roboticists at the Australian National University in 1997 is where the company identifies its roots. Seeing Machine’s director of marketing, Adrian Dean said the researchers were envisioning the “car of the future” and found that it should interact with the passengers inside.

According to Dean, “The future car would need to understand and relate to the occupants and the driver, in a similar way that a humanoid robot would need to.”

“Understanding the driver was the next step in marrying the two together. Because it is about how the driver is interacting with the robot vehicle, but also so that the autonomous car can understand what the occupants are doing when it’s driving,” he added.

As laws require a person to sit behind the wheel of a driver-less car, Tesla’s Autopilot requires the person to touch the wheel regularly. This is beneficial once the car is capable of knowing if the person is able to take over, not sleeping, texting or has his attention on something other than driving.

Understanding the passenger

To understand the passenger inside a car, hardware and software were put together by Seeing Machines. They invented a camera that s is attached to the dashboard, and developed algorithms to process the data. It can collect a series of data points from the position of eyes and face to detecting heart rate through the skin.

“We can measure eyelid closure very accurately, which lets us measure and intervene in micro sleeps. There’s also the head pose — whether it’s tilted a certain way. You can understand if someone is looking down at their phone,” says Dean.

“What we can also detect is where you are looking – using infra-red we detect the glint off your eye to interpret your region of interest. The technology works even if the driver is wearing glasses.”

In the near future the data retrieved could tell the car its passengers’ state and interests. Such technology is still emerging but it is adopted in the mining, aviation and transport industries. It gets data with regards to distractions and micro sleeps, which are causes of accidents.

With more than 4,000 units sold worldwide, Seeing Machines’ quest of reducing risk has led to good results. It saved thousands of live, whether on the city streets or in mining places.

Original article published on www.businessinsider.com.au. Photos retrieved from www.alluremedia.com.au.
article: Innovations in human detection make way for more safety in modern transportation.

title: Virtual Reality transforms the fashion industry
description:
The retail industry has revolutionised since the emergence of mobile and e-commerce technologies. From prioritising in-store experience, retailers now want to connect with customers anytime, anywhere. As these and other technologies are rapidly surfacing and transforming how we shop, it is not a far reality that the physical and digital experience will be merged for a better shopping experience. This is where virtual reality (VR) comes into picture.

Marrying bricks and clicks

The physical and digital stores are now coming together to makeover the shopping experience. The big online retailer Amazon opened its physical store as well as other start up online retailers. Similarly, brick and mortar stores invest on e-commerce. Other physical stores display online information on digital screens; an example is Nordstrom’s “top-pinned” items on Pinterest being shown in-store. With this marriage of bricks and clicks shoppers, can shift seamlessly across channels.

Experiencing the real through the virtual

It’s high time for retailers to experiment on the technology that transports people to different environments without tickets, planes or trains. This is taking the fashion industry to a high-tech platform, which is why big fashion companies like Dior, Balenciaga and Topshop embrace it. Though it takes money and time to build, innovative companies move into this direction to give their customers a new experience.

Another retailer that used VR is the boutique retailer The Line. With the Samsung Gear VR headset, shoppers can tour their store in Manhattan, which is The Apartment. Wherever they are, even halfway around the work, they can still do so with the 3D video technology.

In the same way, VR developers conducted a demo to Reuters of a customer browsing shoes on a display, picking them, trying them on and purchasing virtually. Such platform aims to study customer preferences to provide personalized experience in-store.

Aside from these, shoppers can also watch the Tommy Hilfiger fall 2015 catwalk show with the same headset. They get to have a 360-degree view and a front row seat at the runway. With a three-dimensional view, the experience will be extraordinary, just like a VIP.

Innovating journeys across industries

Apart from retail industry, VR has long been developed for gaming. It creates an immersive experience of virtual environments that makes the gaming experience even more enjoyable. Furthermore, in the automotive industry, VR is emerging. Some examples are Audi and Volvo that created virtual showrooms. Without real cars, potential buyers can explore around the holographic car and it features.

These and many other industries are disrupted by VR. It revolutionises the way we play, shop and live. As it has given optimistic responses, it is expected that VR will continue to transform experiences. For example, creating a virtual model of yourself or other people that you can use to try on clothes on. The virtual is becoming a reality, giving an exceptional shopping experience. Imagine what more it can do. You’ll be amazed.

title: Smartwatch sales direct to a new digital trend
description:
Digital technology is growing exponentially and is becoming a part of the day-to-day lives of people globally. In highly urbanised cities, this is all too evident. Wherever you look, you’ll see smartphones, televisions and computers. This trend has been out for a while now, but unlike other trends, this isn’t going away any time soon, as sales show. In this age of digitising almost everything, tech innovators aren’t just biting into what’s in. They continuously seek for techniques for their products to have some human element. This way, digital devices won’t only take our time of day, but also make our lives better.

Modern day watches

The watch that we used to know, the one with a dial, gears and hands, are at risk of becoming a thing of the past. It is digitised as well, which is why we have smartwatches today. It can display a preview of messages on your cellphone, measure your steps, control the music you play, and a lot more.

With capabilities to do more than just tell time, it is highly regarded in the retail industry to create a better customer experience. Its smart features can get data of customers in store to give them better offerings tailored for them. Also, it could be possible for them to pay at the checkout counters with the smartwatch.

Outselling traditional timepieces

Previously, the sales of analogue watches always surpassed that of the smartwatches. We always want what’s classic. However, in the recent Strategy Analytics (Q4 2015), global smartwatch shipments reached 8.1 million. Compared to 7.9 million Swiss Watches, the digital form has outdone the classic watch for the first time.

Despite being thought earlier as just a fad, smartwatches are here to stay, and grow. It wouldn’t replace traditional watches, but it is a good area of development and digitisation. It is a good trend of upcoming innovation.

Enhancing the human element

The rollout of smartwatches has been successful because it disrupted a platform that is classic and has long been existing. It found a way to put in its power and style that created a unique need from the products that it digitised. It has appealed to the users to have something smart, functional and stylish at the same time.

This inclination is a good sign for digital signage in the retail and other industries. By seeing the movement of modern technology combined with the human element, it might lead to better engagement. As the smartwatch’s success is credited to its human element of making lives better and easier, the future of other technologies, such as digital signage are looking up as well. Thus, capitalising on the human element can captivate customers.

article: Digital technologies see a future potential with smartwatch sales

title: Digital signage: The eco-friendly choice
description:
It’s obvious that more and more technological innovations are surfacing. It’s the age of digitising almost everything; from watches, menu boards, shopping, and to just about anything! Similarly, advertising is moving towards the same direction.

Now, if you’re in doubt about going digital, try asking yourself these questions:

  • Is my business eco-conscious?
  • Do I want to reach consumers from streets and other high traffic outdoors?
  • Will digital help me improve my brand position compared to print?

If you’ve got a ‘yes’ to those three, it’s high time for you to bank on something that will not only help your business, but also preserve the precious and only planet that we have. Wanna know more? Just read on and find out the wonder of digital signage.

Digital signage holds the upper hand versus print advertising

Try picturing this: you have 1500 posters to be printed which took you 2-3 days conceptualizing and printing. It tells about your latest collection for the summer season, and, as it turns out, there are some mistakes in your design that you’ve overlooked and it’s now on your final material. It is too much hassle to fix your design and have it printed again.

With the above example alone, you already have wasted things; time and money. Okay, let’s spice up situation a bit more. You’ll have to pay people to install them around high traffic areas. That’s a lot of money for one roll out. Then, the summer season ended, another pain in your pocket.

Digital signage, however, lets you increase you advertising value while avoiding these costs, and stop using so much materials to reduce waste. Therefore, it has the upper hand in the war for eco-friendliness. Although it’s not 100% eco-friendly, digital signage is the wiser choice because hardware replacement isn’t always done.

But then paper is recyclable, which is eco-friendly

You may argue and say that paper can be recycled, and can do well to our environment, but it is a long and arduous process which has to be done repeatedly. For example, the replacement of print material is on a weekly or monthly basis, which is a bit too harmful. This is because the transport, recycling and the whole process of putting up your print ads require the use of trucks or cars, which emits harmful gases.

Though deploying digital signage may require a lot of energy as well, modern digital displays are optimised to use less energy and last longer, avoiding e-wastes on landfills. This helps avoid long-term environmental impacts.

You and digital signage: a partnership of the future

Instead of using lots of paper and ink and exerting so much work with print ads, it is a reasonable step to go digital. Put in mind how much paper you could save and the impact your business can have on the environment. You would want to position your brand as eco-friendly and increase up time, all while reducing production time and costs.

As digital signage can be managed remotely and assets can be changed quickly without going on site, it is the better choice that can benefit your company in the long run.

Environment concerns are slowly becoming rampant and it’s likely for stricter environmental guidelines to be implemented. It might require businesses to measure and lessen harmful impacts down the line. This might sound “preachy” to you, but it is a real concern, which your brand needs to consider.

Digital signage will be a big shift in your advertising and brand awareness. It will not only captivate outdoor consumers, manage media conveniently and create stylish and dynamic messaging, but laso lets you have a significant and positive impact to the environment.

Original article published on digitalsignagetoday.com.
article: Find out why brands better use the valuable strategy of going pro-Earth.
